page.title: 02GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: THE STUDY AREA IS LOCATED IN THE BOROUGH OF WREXHAM MAELOR. IT IS SITUATED TO THE SOUTH OF THE TOWN AND INCLUDES SMALL VILLAGES AND HAMLETS. IT IS A SPARSELY POPULATED AREA. THE AREA IS UNDULATING RANGING FROM 91M. IN THE WEST TO 46M. IN THE EAST. THERE ARE TWO MAIN STREAMS OF WATER WHICH ARE GEFEILIAU BROOK AND BLACK BROOK. ON BLACK BROOK IS WATS DYKE. BOTH ARE FLOWING IN A NORTHERLY DIRECTION. THERE ARE QUITE A LOT OF PUBLIC FOOTPATHS AND NOT MANY ROADS, ONLY ONE MAIN ROAD GOING THROUGH COCK BANK AND MARCHWIEL. ONE SECONDARY ROAD AND A FEW NARROW LANES WITH SCATERRED HOUSES, IN THE AREA. THERE IS A WIND PUMP, AN OLD HALL, WAT'S DYKE, A FEW FARMS AND MARCHWIEL CHURCH.
